events.originalText: Passengers on a Thalys train from Amsterdam to Paris confronted and subdued an attacker who attempted a mass shooting.
events.subtitle: Thalys
events.headline: Passengers subdue attacker on Thalys train from Amsterdam to Paris

events.originalText: Syrian civil war: Areas controlled by the Syrian opposition in Ghouta, Damascus, were attacked by rockets (launcher pictured) containing sarin, killing at least 281 people.
events.subtitle: Syrian civil war
events.headline: Syrian opposition areas in Ghouta attacked with sarin, 281 dead

events.originalText: A limnic eruption of Lake Nyos in Cameroon released a cloud of carbon dioxide, suffocating 1,746 people and 3,500 livestock.
events.subtitle: Limnic eruption
events.headline: Limnic eruption in Lake Nyos suffocates 1,746 in Cameroon

events.originalText: Six people were killed during an escape attempt and riot at San Quentin State Prison in California; the subsequent trial of six inmates was the longest in state history at the time.
events.subtitle: San Quentin Six
events.headline: Six killed in riot at San Quentin State Prison in California

events.originalText: South Vietnamese special forces loyal to Ngô Đình Nhu, the brother of President Ngô Đình Diệm, raided and vandalised Buddhist pagodas  across the country, arresting thousands and leaving hundreds dead.
events.subtitle: Army of the Republic of Vietnam Special Forces
events.headline: South Vietnamese special forces raid Buddhist pagodas, hundreds dead

events.originalText: American physicist Harry Daghlian accidentally dropped a tungsten carbide brick onto a plutonium bomb core, exposing himself to neutron radiation and later becoming the first Manhattan Project fatality due to a criticality accident.
events.subtitle: Harry Daghlian
events.headline: Physicist Harry Daghlian first Manhattan Project fatality

events.originalText: World War II: A combined Canadian–Polish force captured the town of Falaise, France, in the final offensive of the Battle of Normandy.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Canadian-Polish force captures Falaise in Battle of Normandy

events.originalText: World War II: The Imperial Japanese Army lost the Battle of the Tenaru, the first of its three major land offensives during the Guadalcanal Campaign.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Imperial Japanese Army loses Battle of the Tenaru in Guadalcanal Campaign

events.originalText: Leonardo da Vinci's Mona Lisa (pictured) was stolen from the Louvre by museum employee Vincenzo Peruggia and was not recovered until two years later.
events.subtitle: Leonardo da Vinci
events.headline: Mona Lisa stolen from Louvre by Vincenzo Peruggia

events.originalText: The first of seven debates between Abraham Lincoln and Stephen A. Douglas (both pictured), candidates for an Illinois seat in the U.S. Senate, was held in Ottawa, Illinois.
events.subtitle: Lincoln–Douglas debates
events.headline: Lincoln and Douglas debate in Illinois Senate race

events.originalText: Peninsular War: British–Portuguese forces put an end to the first French invasion of Portugal at the Battle of Vimeiro.
events.subtitle: Peninsular War
events.headline: British-Portuguese forces defeat French at Battle of Vimeiro

events.originalText: The national colours of Italy first appeared on a tricolour cockade in Genoa.
events.subtitle: National colours of Italy
events.headline: Italy's national colours appear on tricolour cockade in Genoa

events.originalText: Austro-Turkish War: Austrian troops under the command of Prince Eugene of Savoy captured the strategically important city of Belgrade from the Ottoman Empire.
events.subtitle: Austro-Turkish War (1716–1718)
events.headline: Austrian troops capture Belgrade from Ottoman Empire

events.originalText: Seventh Ottoman–Venetian War: Ottoman forces suddenly abandoned their siege of Corfu, allowing the Republic of Venice to preserve its rule over the Ionian Islands.
events.subtitle: Ottoman–Venetian War (1714–1718)
events.headline: Venice preserves rule over Ionian Islands as Ottomans abandon siege of Corfu

events.originalText: Jacobite risings: Jacobite clans clashed with a regiment of Covenanters in the streets of Dunkeld, Scotland.
events.subtitle: Jacobitism
events.headline: Jacobite clans clash with Covenanters in Dunkeld, Scotland
